intro: Lasiopetalum erectifolium, commonly known as the upright-leaved mistflower, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry inland regions.
